comment: LOTS of reading and attendance is mandatory! The great teaching really makes up for it though. She is truly passionate about what she teaches and some of her lectures had me on the edge of my seat and ready to actively participate in class discussion. Also, she grades very fair and can tell whether you actually tried or not.

I took Dr. Peterson, and you can tell she's passionate about her teaching; there's a reading response due every weekend, and it can be challenging if you don't read the readings thoroughly, but she grades very fairly. Attendance is a grade.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Lecture heavy

comment: Attendance is important for her classes. Not too much homework, just a couple of readings a week, a video of some sort, and a reading response paper. She was really nice and encouraged discussion!
rating_tags: So many papers--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Peterson had heavy lecture classes. She goes over the reading for the week, then for homework every weekend you have to turn in about a page and a half about the topic. Overall she is an easy grader and I would recommend her but even though she says you need to read the documents, you really don't need to. No tests either!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--So many papers--Lecture heavy

comment: I love professor petersen. This class should be mandatory for all students its that good. I would recommend any and everyone to take her class! There is a lot of reading but you can get by with summaries or reading just a couple pages. There is 2 reading assignments and 1 video assignment each week that you have to write a 1-2 page summarizing them
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Inspirational--Respected

comment: Professor Petersen is a fantastic professor, but do not take this class if you don't care about gender studies. I thought it would be easy, but there is A LOT of reading, and it's boring if you're not interested in gender studies. She is a fantastic teacher, but you read more in this class than an English class. The textbook is horrible too.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: need your book for the discussions easy quizzes but must read in order to do well on all discussions and the final, overall easy class
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: An easy online class, with a mandatory textbook. Weekly quizzes that aren't an entire breeze but this class won't take more than 2 hours a week. You have to read this unbearable book that was offensive being such an explicit fictional book. Otherwise she's great! Easy to talk to and very reasonable and sweet.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Love her! If you need an elective credit, take this class with her!! She is caring, and this course will basically help you with your future in the workplace. Class is discussion based, and there are about 3-4 short papers. I highly recommend her!
rating_tags: Hilarious--Amazing lectures--Caring

comment: She gives you 3 quizzes then a discussion post is done after doing those readings. Use her ppts & you should do fine on the quizzes. Use quotes from the book and try to respond back to someone that responded to your post since youre keeping the convo going . Her EC is easy since you can use one of the posts you already wrote & make it from that.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: she's amazing, kind, and is very open to opinions and whatnot. she's a great professor for this class, and if you can, definitely take her. she's funny and doesn't give hard assignments at all. not hard to pass!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Inspirational--Hilarious

comment: One of the best professor's I've had at KSU. Prof. Petersen takes a broad field and touches on many sub topics within it while making information digestible and accessible to students to better grasp these controversial issues. She has perfected using multimedia in the classroom and conducting in class activities. Group project but can be fun!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: So easy! We had weekly quizzes over a chapter each week and every few weeks we had a discussion post instead. She gives you a paragraph of feedback after each discussion post which is very helpful. The quizzes are straight from the book and the final is two essay questions over the main concept of the book. Her extra credit is a book/movie review
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: First of all, SHE IS THE BEST. I loved her class (Love & Sex) sooooo much. We covered so many amazing topics and I wish everyone was required to take this class. I personally came out of it as a more open minded, well educated individual. Read the articles, come to class, and free yourself. Dr. Petersen, if you're reading this, THANK YOU SM! <3
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Amazing lectures--Caring

comment: Easy A. No textbook, just articles or a chapter in 1 of 3 books required before each class. Grades attendance and participation, but lectures are interesting. If you get a 100 on every assignment then you don't have to do the final research paper which is 7+ pages. She's so sweet and funny so lectures are interesting. Would take her again.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tests? Not many

comment: Professor Petersen is phenomenal. She really knows how to encourage discussion while not being forceful. You can tell she is extremely passionate about the subject. Each day you have a reading before class that you have a quiz over, but they are open note so are long as you know how to CTRL-F you will do fine on them.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures--Caring

comment: Dr. Petersen is one of the best professors I have had. She really cares about her students and is willing to work with you. There is reading before every class and a quiz on the reading at the beginning of class. The quizzes are open note though. Just be sure to participate in discussion, which is not hard because she makes discussion interesting!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Even though I didn't really like this course due to the content, Dr. Petersen makes it interesting and she is really passionate about her subject. She gives wonderful feedback and knows what how to teach her students. My only problem is that the classes are lecture heavy. No textbook though.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Caring

comment: This class was not in my major so I took it for something interesting. Professor Petersen was very clear in her assignments. She gives a very detailed syllabus so there are no surprises. I enjoyed this class, it was fun and I learned a lot about the gender difficulties.

Great teacher and great class, I took this class as a hybrid and it's easy as long as you do the work. Attendance is mandatory but you'll want to go to class with each class being interesting and enjoyable. Great class discussion, 4 essays, read the articles and take the quizzes and you can get an A. One of the best teachers I've ever had.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Inspirational--Hilarious

comment: Professor Petersen is one of my favorite people, BY FAR. She has a very clear & organized class, including due dates and assignments well ahead of time. Readings are LONG but for the most part interesting & she explains them well & gives time for questions. Grades are attendance(hybrid), reading quiz/ post, and 5 papers(3-5pg). EASY A, TAKE HER.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: Overall this class is okay, she's a great professor though! I took this as a hybrid class so attendance was mandatory since we only met twice a week. It's an overall good class, very interesting. The class goes by fast so make sure you stay on top of everything or you'll fall behind. Read your articles, do your discussion and you should be fine.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Dr. Petersen is new, but shes a great professor. The class HAS NO TEXT BOOK (atleast when I'm taking it). All the readings are posted on D2L however that doesnt make them short. She only has a group presentation/3 respones papers/final paper. Lectures are what your class makes of it, so speak up! Your interactions makes the class so to speak. ^_^
